page.title: 06RUDGWICK C.P.SCHOOL-HISTORY
page.content: The{ORIGINAL}school began life in{1880 in a{VICTORIAN}building which was then on a quiet rural road.}Initially the school taught pupils from{5-14}years. In{1980}the school celebrated its{CEN- {TENARY}though by then it was a{2}site school.In{1972}a new and more{CENTRAL- {LY}located school building was built. For{13}years,however,the old building continued accommodating the{INFANTS - {(pupils of 5-7)}a situation which con- cerned{PARENTS,TEACHERS & GOVERNORS because of the danger of{TRAFFIC.}Sad- ness mingled with relief,therefore in {JULY 1985}when after{105}years,the old building was finally closed and all of the infant children moved to the prem- ises with the{JUNIORS}(pupils{7-11). The move became possible by the build- ing of{4}new classrooms on the{1972 {SITE.}The school at present caters for {207}pupils but increases are likely.
